events.message: I submitted a claim today after my car was involved in a collision at an intersection, resulting in significant damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the description involving my vehicle and the accident details.
An agent was promptly assigned to my case, and they provided clear instructions on the following steps for the claims process.
I received an official acknowledgment of my claim via email, confirming that it is being processed and under review.
The insurance company requested additional documents including a police report, photos of the accident scene, and repair estimates.
I submitted all requested documents through the online portal, ensuring that the police report and vehicle repair estimates were attached.
The investigation team has begun reviewing the submitted documents and examining the case details to assess liability and damage.
The investigation was completed successfully, confirming the accident circumstances and validating the submitted evidence.
The insurer proposed a settlement offer that covers the estimated repair costs and rental car expenses incurred during the vehicle’s downtime.
I provided positive feedback regarding the claims process and expressed satisfaction with the timely and professional treatment by the agent.
The claim was officially approved, confirming that the settlement terms are accepted and the payment process will commence shortly.
I received the payment in full to cover all verified damages and related expenses as per the settlement agreement.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance, and I was informed that no further actions are required from my side.
My claim file was archived in the company’s records for future reference and potential audits.
